facts.name: Sam Slover
facts.bio: Sam is a designer and developer working on interactive technology projects in NYC. He is the founder of Sage, a smarter food labeling platform. He co-founded Learn It Live, an online learning website that connects people to health and wellness experts in live video sessions. He was also an inaugural member of First Round Capital's Dorm Room Fund, where he invested in NYC student-run companies. He's previously worked on social entrepreneur initiatives with communities in Honduras and India, and launched a seed capital program at a micro-finance firm in Bolivia. His design work has been featured in Techcrunch, Fast Company, Forbes, Business Insider, Inc. Magazine, Mashable, Popular Science, PSFK, and BBC. He's a graduate of New York University's Interactive Telecommunications Program where he is an adjunct professor and was formerly in residency.
